alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:27AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Clark, southeastern Floyd and central Jefferson Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 527 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Louisville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Audubon Park and Newburg around 535 AM EDT. West Buechel, Northfield, Watterson Park, Lynnview, Seneca Gardens, Strathmoor Village, Rolling Fields, Glenview, Riverwood and Norbourne Estates around 540 AM EDT. St. Matthews, Hurstbourne, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills, St. Regis Park, Beechwood Village, Barbourmeade, Woodlawn Park, Bellemeade and Plantation around 545 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Jeffersontown, Lyndon, Douglass Hills, Anchorage, Hurstbourne Acres, Coldstream, Rolling Hills, Langdon Place, Blue Ridge Manor, Meadow Vale, Middletown, Worthington Hills and Woodland Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
